0.sentence: I purchased this router at a woodworking show after watching the CMT people using it to demo their bits and was impressed how it performed.

1.sentence: The adjustment knob seemed ok, but when lowering the router, I have to practically pull it down while turning the knob.

2.sentence: The collet for the 1/4 inch bits is a pain to get in and even harder to get out.

3.sentence: Then the most disappointing was trying to use Viper raised panel bits that just barely fit, and I mean just barely.

4.sentence: From the Internet, woodworking books, local stores and personal opinions the Hitachi M12V 3-1/4 HP router time and time again came up to be the router of choice or best for its price.

5.sentence: But I wanted to do some raised panel work and needed more power and variable speed to run the large-diameter bits.

6.sentence: But I wanted to do some raised panel work and needed more power and variable speed to run the large-diameter bits.

7.sentence: The Hitachi has plenty of power, runs smooth, and cuts effortlessly through maple (with Freud bits!)

8.sentence: The Hitachi has plenty of power, runs smooth, and cuts effortlessly through maple (with Freud bits!)

9.sentence: The Hitachi has plenty of power, runs smooth, and cuts effortlessly through maple (with Freud bits!)

10.sentence: However, it is much bigger, bulkier, and heavier than my other router and I would not like to use it freehand (I keep it mounted in a table).

13.sentence: Since I use it in a table, I don't use the plunge feature, but if I ever need it I've got it.

14.sentence: The Hitachi is a great router for a great price, but only get it if you need the maximum power, variable speed and use it in a table.

18.sentence: Otherwise, get a smaller single speed router, which will be much easier to use freehand and is all you need for smaller diameter bits.

19.sentence: The Hitachi is made in Malasyia, and looked cheap compared with the Makita, which is made in the USA.

20.sentence: If you think you are saving $40 getting the Hitachi, you are right, and you are also getting a router worth $40 less than a Makita.

21.sentence: It ain't cutting edge (no pun intended) state of the art with all the latest bells & whistles & it definitely ain't pretty.

22.sentence: But it is smooth, it is powerful, it is affordable & it has a proven track record.

23.sentence: But it is smooth, it is powerful, it is affordable & it has a proven track record.

26.sentence: I built my own router table with a tilt up top & made a hand crank to replace the height adjustment knob & these two things make it easy to change out & raise or lower the bits.

27.sentence: So for the money it costs for one of those top-of-the-line models I've got a good router & a nice table to put it in & I like that.

28.sentence: So for the money it costs for one of those top-of-the-line models I've got a good router & a nice table to put it in & I like that.

29.sentence: Hitachi's M12V is a big beast of a router.

30.sentence: It's not the heaviest around (I think Porter-Cable has that distinction), but I found its combination of weight and power really too much to allow precise handheld operation.

31.sentence: It's not the heaviest around (I think Porter-Cable has that distinction), but I found its combination of weight and power really too much to allow precise handheld operation.

33.sentence: In my table the M12V has been a real champ.

34.sentence: The heavy motor and continuously variable speed control let this router churn through everything I threw at it.

35.sentence: The heavy motor and continuously variable speed control let this router churn through everything I threw at it.

36.sentence: With the PlungeLIFT all my bit changing has been done above the table, although I still have to reach below the table to operate the spindle lock (and, of course, the speed and ON/OFF controls).

99.sentence: Mine was so bad I had to to use a hammer to free it (and this is why I'm giving it 4, not 5 stars).

100.sentence: I have noted that as you use the tool, sawdust builds in the channel and it requires attention.

101.sentence: Not a killer problem, but not well done, either.

120.sentence: I find it very stable and comfortable to use, it doesn't jump around or make me feel like I need to use a lot of arm strength to keep it under control, and  it has very good visibility to see your cut.

124.sentence: Also I like the  position of all the controls and the fact that it doesn't have any extra  knobs or gizmos.

126.sentence: The router has plenty  of power for any type of bit or wood I need to cut, and the speed control  knob is easy to get to.

132.sentence: Its  not a perfect system but its a very good one.

211.sentence: I could take 1/2" passes and it still didn't skip a beat.
